TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SqlCacheDependencySection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Configures the SQL cache dependencies for an ASP.NET application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SqlCacheDependencySection allows you to programmatically access and modify the `sqlCacheDependency` element of the `cache` configuration section.
The SQL cache dependency allows the cached data to be synchronized with the original source. After you configure the relationship between an item stored in an ASP.NET application's cache and a specific SQL Server database table, an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> class monitors the table so that when an item in the table changes, the item is automatically removed from the cache.
The settings in this element only affect the table-based version of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> object. The row-level <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> objects used with [!INCLUDE[sqprsqlong](~/add/includes/sqprsqlong-md.md)] and above are not affected by these settings.
> [!NOTE] > The SqlCacheDependencySection can write information into the related section of the configuration file according to the restrictions defined by the section property <xref:System.Configuration.SectionInformation.AllowDefinition%2A> whose value is <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationAllowDefinition>. Any attempt to write in a configuration file at a level not allowed in the hierarchy will result in an error message generated by the parser. However, you can use this class to read configuration information at any level in the hierarchy.
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain the SqlCacheDependencySection object from the configuration file of an existing Web application.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_59_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_59_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SqlCacheDependencySection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection> class by using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of objects stored within the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Databases property allows you to programmatically access the `databases` element of the [sqlCacheDependency Element for caching (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/3ffabd95-87b6-4a52-b753-9d298d43841d) of the `cache` section a configuration file.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Databases property.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_339_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_339_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the database table should be monitored for changes.
Docs.value: if SQL cache monitoring is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks After you configure the relationship between an item stored in an ASP.NET application's cache and a specific SQL Server database table, an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> class monitors the table so that when an item in the table changes the item is automatically removed from the cache.
For this class to work correctly, the database and any tables on which you want to set dependencies must have notifications enabled. For more information, see the remarks provided for the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> class.
> [!NOTE] > Gets or sets a value indicating whether the database tables that have active <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> objects should be monitored for changes. This setting does not affect the row-level <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> objects.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Enabled property.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_112_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_112_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the frequency with which the polls the database table for changes.
Docs.value: The SQL cache dependency polling time, in milliseconds. The default is 500.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PollTime property defines the time frequency with which ASP.NET polls the database for changes in the table linked to the cached item.
**Note** The frequency can be overridden on a database level in the `databases` element of the `sqlCacheDependency` in the `cache` configuration section.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the PollTime property.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_52_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_52_1.vb)]
